content: The **Catholic Church in Malaysia, Singapore and Brunei** (its two small Malay neighbors) is composed of a [Latin Church](/wiki/Latin_Church) hierarchy, joint in the transnational *[Episcopal Conference](/wiki/Episcopal_Conference) of Malaysia, Singapore and [Brunei](/wiki/Brunei)*, consisting of three [ecclesiastical provinces](/wiki/Ecclesiastical_province) in Malaysia, a non-metropolitan archdiocese for Singapore, and a pre-diocesan [Apostolic Vicariate](/wiki/Apostolic_Vicariate) for [Brunei](/wiki/Brunei). There are no [Eastern Catholic](/wiki/Eastern_Catholic) jurisdictions. There is an [Apostolic Nunciature](/wiki/Apostolic_Nunciature) to Malaysia as papal diplomatic representation (embassy-level) in the national capital Kuala Lumpur. In it the [Apostolic Delegation](/wiki/Apostolic_Delegation) (lower level) to Brunei is also vested. There is a separate Apostolic Nunciature to Singapore (in the capital of the same name), into which are vested the Non-Residential Pontifical Representation for Vietnam and Apostolic Nunciature to the [Association of Southeast Asian Nations](/wiki/Association_of_Southeast_Asian_Nations) (ASEAN, which all abovementioned states belong to, with others in the region). ## Current Latin jurisdictions ### Exempt jurisdictions - [Archdiocese of Singapore](/wiki/Archdiocese_of_Singapore), covering all and only Singapore - [Apostolic Vicariate of Brunei Darussalam](/wiki/Apostolic_Vicariate_of_Brunei_Darussalam), covering all and only Brunei ### Ecclesiastical Province of Kuala Lumpur covering [Peninsular Malaysia](/wiki/Peninsular_Malaysia) - Metropolitan [Archdiocese of Kuala Lumpur](/wiki/Roman_Catholic_Archdiocese_of_Kuala_Lumpur) - [Diocese of Malacca-Johor](/wiki/Roman_Catholic_Diocese_of_Malacca-Johor) - [Diocese of Penang](/wiki/Roman_Catholic_Diocese_of_Penang) ### Ecclesiastical Province of Kuching covering [Sarawak](/wiki/Sarawak) state, on Borneo - Metropolitan [Archdiocese of Kuching](/wiki/Roman_Catholic_Archdiocese_of_Kuching) - [Diocese of Miri](/wiki/Roman_Catholic_Diocese_of_Miri) - [Diocese of Sibu](/wiki/Roman_Catholic_Diocese_of_Sibu) ### Ecclesiastical Province of Kota Kinabalu covering [Sabah](/wiki/Sabah) state, on Borneo - Metropolitan [Archdiocese of Kota Kinabalu](/wiki/Roman_Catholic_Archdiocese_of_Kota_Kinabalu) - [Diocese of Keningau](/wiki/Roman_Catholic_Diocese_of_Keningau) - [Diocese of Sandakan](/wiki/Roman_Catholic_Diocese_of_Sandakan). ## Former jurisdictions There are no titular sees. All defunct jurisdictions have current successor sees. The [Archdiocese of Malacca-Singapore](/wiki/Roman_Catholic_Archdiocese_of_Malacca-Singapore) was split into the [Archdiocese of Singapore](/wiki/Archdiocese_of_Singapore) and the [Diocese of Malacca-Johor](/wiki/Roman_Catholic_Diocese_of_Malacca-Johor) in 1972, seven years after Singapore [became independent](/wiki/Independence_of_Singapore_Agreement_1965). - [List of Catholic dioceses (structured view)](/wiki/List_of_Catholic_dioceses_(structured_view)) - [Catholic Church in Malaysia](/wiki/Catholic_Church_in_Malaysia) - [Catholic Church in Brunei](/wiki/Catholic_Church_in_Brunei) - [Catholic Church in Singapore](/wiki/Catholic_Church_in_Singapore) ## Sources and external links - GCatholic.org - data for all sections. - Catholic-Hierarchy entry.
title: List of Catholic dioceses in Malaysia, Singapore, and Brunei
